intro: Daucus visnaga, commonly known as the Persian cow-plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its medicinal properties. The seeds are used in traditional medicine and can be harvested for their aromatic qualities.
